comments.body:
is there any reason why we are making it generic using `interface{}`? if i am not mistaken we are using it for `requestDecision` only, so we could make it more strictly typed - `Get() requestDecision`. This way we can avoid code snippets like this now:
```
	decisionAny := req.decision.Get()
	decision, isDecision := decisionAny.(requestDecision)
	if !isDecision {
		panic(fmt.Sprintf("QS(%s): Impossible decision %#+v (of type %T) for request %#+v %#+v", qs.qCfg.Name, decisionAny, decisionAny, req.descr1, req.descr2))
	}
```

If we are making it generic for future purposes, then I would say we can refactor and make it more generic when we need to in the future.
Yes, I made it generic because the concept is generic.

If you don't mind, I would prefer to keep it obviously generic.
I realized that there are other panics in `queueset.go`, so I revised to get rid of all of them.
